laboratory_examinations.findings: Basal serum calcitonin level was 850 pg/ml (normal range, 2–17 pg/ml)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: One month after surgery, decreased to 38 pg/ml; six months after thyroidectomy, rose to 66 pg/ml; two and a half years after thyroidectomy, rose to 235 pg/ml.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Urinary Fractionated Catecholamines, Metanephrines, and Vanillylmandelic Acid

laboratory_examinations.findings: Heterogeneous echogenicity of the thyroid tissue with multiple calcified areas and multiple enlarged lymph nodes.
Demonstrated uptake within the adrenal mass
Hypodense, 7.6 cm mass with coarse foci of calcification in the right suprarenal fossa.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Eighteen months after resection, no gross recurrence on CT imaging.
